intro: Cleistocactus santacruzensis, commonly known as the Santa Cruz cactus, is a species of cactus native to the arid regions of northern Argentina. It is characterized by its cylindrical stems that are often ribbed and covered in a layer of white, waxy bloom. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that emerge from the areoles, typically during the spring and summer months. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water availability. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in arid gardens and botanical collections.
